intro: Alyxia fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, featuring small, opposite leaves and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Alyxia fascicularis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
